Module it.am04softeng.codexnaturalis
Package Server.Card

Class AchievementFrontFace

java.lang.Object
Server.Card.EmptyCardFace
Server.Card.AchievementFrontFace
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, CardFace
public class AchievementFrontFace extends EmptyCardFace
This is the class for the front face of achievement cards

  • Method Details

    • getScoreRequirements

      public Map<Symbol,Integer> getScoreRequirements() throws UnsupportedOperationException
      Description copied from interface: CardFace
      Returns the score requirements.
      Specified by:
      getScoreRequirements in interface CardFace
      Overrides:
      getScoreRequirements in class EmptyCardFace
      Returns:
      the score requirements as a map of Symbol and Integer. For achievement cards There are either 1 or 3 symbols in the map keySet. If there are 3 symbols, the player gets 3 points for every set of those 3 symbols. If there is 1 symbol, if the symbol is a pattern, the player gets the map's value in points for every pattern of that type. If the symbol is a resource, the player gets 2 points for every set of the number corresponding to the map's value of resource. For gold cards, the player gets instead tbe number indicated in score of points for each of the symbol specified in the only key in the map.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - because empty card faces do not have score requirements

    • getPlacementRequirements

      public Map<Symbol,Integer> getPlacementRequirements() throws UnsupportedOperationException
      Description copied from interface: CardFace
      Returns the placement requirements
      Specified by:
      getPlacementRequirements in interface CardFace
      Overrides:
      getPlacementRequirements in class EmptyCardFace
      Returns:
      the placement requirements as a map of Symbol and Integer. The map contains the requirements for the placement of the card. The keySet contains the symbols that are required for the placement of the card. The value is the number of symbols required.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - because achievement cards do not have placement requirements

    • getXCoord

      public int getXCoord() throws UnsupportedOperationException
      Description copied from interface: CardFace
      Returns the x coordinate of the CardFace
      Specified by:
      getXCoord in interface CardFace
      Overrides:
      getXCoord in class EmptyCardFace
      Returns:
      int the x coordinate where the face is placed. If the face is not placed, it returns 0.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - because achievement cards do not have coordinates
